terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Financial Technology - the integration of technology into offerings by financial services companies to improve their use and delivery to consumers
Frequently Asked Questions - a compilation of common questions and their answers, typically used in documentation to address user queries
The process of examining datasets to draw conclusions about the information they contain, often used to inform business decisions
Unified Payments Interface - a real-time payment system that facilitates inter-bank transactions through mobile platforms
Artificial Intelligence - computer systems designed to perform tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as learning and problem-solving
Automated software programs that simulate human conversation through text or voice interactions, commonly used for customer support
A distributed digital ledger technology that maintains a continuously growing list of records, linked and secured using cryptography
Digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security and operates independently of traditional banking systems
General Data Protection Regulation - European Union regulation governing data protection and privacy for individuals within the EU
The practice of protecting digital information from unauthorized access, corruption, or theft throughout its entire lifecycle
The process of ensuring that an organization adheres to laws, regulations, and guidelines relevant to its business operations
A standard in the financial industry that ensures investment advisors and financial institutions verify the identity of their clients
A single point of access or distribution that consolidates multiple information sources or communication pathways
A detailed analysis of a particular instance, event, or project used to illustrate principles or demonstrate outcomes in documentation
